member.name: T:ExternalControls.ColorSet
member.summary: Specifies the set of colors to be displayed in the color palette.

remarks.I: If any other useful sets of colors are known please let me know.

member.name: F:ExternalControls.ColorSet.System
member.summary: Show the system color palette.

member.name: F:ExternalControls.ColorSet.Web
member.summary: Show the web color palette.

member.name: F:ExternalControls.ColorSet.Custom
member.summary: Show user defined color palette.

member.name: T:ExternalControls.ColorSortOrder
member.summary: Specifies the order the colors contained in the selected palette should be sorted.

remarks.I: If any other useful sort orders are known please let me know.

member.name: F:ExternalControls.ColorSortOrder.Name
member.summary: Sort by name.

member.name: F:ExternalControls.ColorSortOrder.Brightness
member.summary: Sort by brightness.

member.name: F:ExternalControls.ColorSortOrder.Hue
member.summary: Sort by hue.

member.name: F:ExternalControls.ColorSortOrder.Saturation
member.summary: Sort by saturation.

member.name: F:ExternalControls.ColorSortOrder.Distance
member.summary: Sort by linear distance from the origin (0,0,0) of the RGB color space.

member.name: F:ExternalControls.ColorSortOrder.Unsorted
member.summary:
Colors are sorted according to their original order.
For System and Web color sets this is the same as sort by name.
For custom colors it will be the order of the colors in the array assigned to the CustomColors property

member.name: T:ExternalControls.ColorPanel
member.summary: A control that allows the selection of a color from a fixed color palette.
member.remarks:
The color panel displays a grid of colors. These colors are either derived from the System.Drawing.KnownColor enumeration, or supplied by the user using the CustomColor property.
The set of colors displayed is controlled by the ColorSet property.

member.name: M:ExternalControls.ColorPanel.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ColorPanel class.
member.remarks: The default constructor initializes all fields to their default values.

member.summary: Raises the ColorChanged event.

member.summary: Get the color well at the specified point.

member.summary: Get the first color well with the specified color. There may be multiple color wells with the same color for custom color palettes. Note that Color.White != Color.Window even when Color.Window is white!

member.summary: Get the sorted index of the color well (not the original index).

member.summary: Overrides the OnClick event in order to detect user color selection.

member.summary: Change the color currently selected. Does not cause a ColorChanged event.

member.summary: Overrides the OnMouseMove event in order to track mouse movement.

member.name: M:ExternalControls.ColorPanel.OnMouseLeave(System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Overrides OnMouseLeave in order to detect when the mouse has left the control.

member.name: M:ExternalControls.ColorPanel.OnGotFocus(System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Overrides OnGotFocus so the control can be redrawn with the focus.

member.name: M:ExternalControls.ColorPanel.OnLostFocus(System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Overrides OnLostFocus so the control can be redrawn without the focus.

member.name: M:ExternalControls.ColorPanel.IsInputKey(System.Windows.Forms.Keys)
member.summary:
Overrides IsInputKey.
This allows the control to tell the base class that the keys Keys.Left, Keys.Right, Keys.Up and Keys.Down should cause the OnKeyDown event.
member.returns: true if keyData is one of Keys.Left, Keys.Right, Keys.Up and Keys.Down. Otherwise false.

member.name: M:ExternalControls.ColorPanel.OnKeyDown(System.Windows.Forms.KeyEventArgs)
member.summary:
Overrides OnKeyDown so that a color may be selected using the keyboard.
Use the keys - Left, Right, Up, Down and Enter.

member.name: M:ExternalControls.ColorPanel.GetPreferredWidth
member.summary:
When the ColorPanel is being resized GetPreferredWidth is called to determine the preferred width. For ColorPanel the preferred width is the control's default Width, i.e the control may be resized.
Derived classes, such as ColorPanelWithCapture may override this.

member.name: M:ExternalControls.ColorPanel.AutoSizePanel
member.summary:
This method is called internally to set the control's size.
If the Columns property is 0 then the control fixes it's width to the nearest number of columns that fit into the value returned by GetPreferredWidth.
If the Columns property is greater than 0 then the control will display that many columns.

member.name: M:ExternalControls.ColorPanel.OnResize(System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Overrides OnResize so the control can be auto-sized.
member.remarks: The control auto-sizes. It first fixes the width to the nearest whole multiple of the color well width, and then fixes the height to the nearest whole multiple of the color well height.

member.name: M:ExternalControls.ColorPanel.OnEnabledChanged(System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Overrides OnEnabledChanged so the control can redraw itself enabled/disabled.

member.summary: Overrides OnPaint so the control can be drawn.

member.summary: Override OnSystemColorsChanged to that the System color palette can be updated when a user modifies the system colors.

member.summary:
Set/get the order in which colors in the palette should be sorted.
See ColorSortOrder.

member.name: P:ExternalControls.ColorPanel.Columns
member.summary:
Set/get the number of preferred columns.
If you set this value less than or equal to 0, you may resize the control.
If you set this greater that 0 the control will have a fixed width of 'Columns' unless there are fewer colors than 'Columns' in the palette in which case it will display all colors in a single row.

member.summary: Set/get the custom color palette to be displayed.

member.name: T:ExternalControls.CustomColorPicker
member.summary: A control that allows the user to select any color from the RGB color space.
member.remarks:
The control presents a 2 dimensional slice through the 3D color cube. The user may select Red, Green or Blue to be the z-axis where the z-axis extends into the screen and the x and y-axes are the remaining pair of colors. The control displays a 256x256 color palette calculated over the x and y axes combined with the selected z-axis value. This palette is varied continuously as the user changes the selected z-axis value.
The control is based on Peter McMahon's ColorPicker.NET. I have translated it to C#, improved performance and made it into a reusable control.

member.name: M:ExternalControls.CustomColorPicker.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a CustomColorPicker control. It defaults to the blue/green side of the color cube (z-axis=red).

member.summary: Override OnResize.
member.remarks:
OnResize is overridden in order to autosize the control.
The control's width may be set freely but if the AutoSize property is set to true the control's height is fixed to Font.Height + Border.Height + 4.

member.name: P:ExternalControls.ColorPicker._Text
member.summary:
The _Text property is the same as the Text property.
This property has been provided because there seems to be a problem with UserControl.Text in Visual Studio beta 2, whereby values set in the property tab are lost.

This enable the ColorPanel control to be dropped down by the ColorPicker.
